text.title: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot

head.s: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot

p.s: Follow these steps to build your own model of a swarm robot .
They may not demonstrate the kind of " swarm intelligence " you 'd hope to see in a real swarm robotics project , but it can be fun to put them together and watch them swarm around in a bunch .

item.s: Cut two 4 pieces of 16 - 24 gauge wire .
Any kind of wire you have available is fine .
Some options are using a wire hanger , annealed wire , galvanized , electrical copper wire , or even pipe cleaners .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 1.jpg

item.s: Bend both wire pieces at the middle ; one shaped like a U and the other shaped like an M. These will be your swarm robot 's legs .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 2.jpg

item.s: Cut a 1 inch by 2.5 inch thin piece of plastic , wood , or aluminum .
This will be the body of your swarm robot .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 3.jpg

item.s: Get a small DC powered universal brush motor .
You can find them and salvage from small electrical toys , purchase online , or from your local hobby store .
They are some of the cheapest , most simple and easiest to power and run .
They can run from as little as 1.5 volts up to 12 volts depending on their size .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 4.jpg

item.s: Solder one terminal of the motor to a 3 inch thin electrical wire .
For this build it wo n't matter which side you pick since universal motors run on either polarity ( + - ) or ( - + ) and current charge ( A/C . or D/C ) .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 5.jpg

item.s: Solder a thin electrical wire to the other end of the motor .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 6.jpg

item.s: If you 're able to find a small switch , solder one end of the switch terminal to one of the electrical wires on the motor .
This is an option if you want to turn on and off your robot without having to pull the cable , battery off .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 7.jpg

item.s: Attach the motor to the body of the swarm robot with a hot glue gun .
Attach or glue a single blade propeller to the motor shaft .
This will cause the motor to run out of balance and shake and vibrate the entire frame of the robot .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 8.jpg

item.s: Glue the wire legs to the body .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 9.jpg

item.s: Tape one wire from the motor and the other end/switch ) to a AAA battery .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 10.jpg

item.s: Turn the swarm robot on and place it down on a flat surface .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 11.jpg

item.s: Watch it shake around and roll like a swarming ant or termite .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 12.jpg

item.s: Find as many motors as you can and build a robot for each one .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 13.jpg

item.s: Repeat the building process and connect all the robots in series .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 14.jpg

item.s: Use a cell phone charger to power them all at once .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 15.jpg

head.s: Making An advanced Swarm of Robots

item.s: Solder a Infrared receiver diode to a small Servomotor and an Electronic controlled board .

You can find these kind of boards from several open source Hardware and Open source Software available online to program each mini receiver boards to your
Swarm Bots .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 16.jpg

item.s: You can find any size or power capacity of suitable motor for your Project .

Some surprisingly powerful miniature motors on cell phone or pager vibrators is a good way to
Up-cycle all those old cell phones
stashed in a box on the attic or garage .
Program each robot caring a E.S.C ( electronic Speed Controller ) with a E.S.C. programing card .
These kind of cards have adapters with fittings to the servo , Brush-less or stepper motors , a power source and a connection to a transmitter .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 17.jpg

item.s:
A programming card has a connection that fits the E.S.C 's transmitter input adapter and a USB to program language and Code Instructions to the
Swarm Bots
.
Solder a set of color coded LCD 's to the board .
You can program your robots to light up a certain color and even behave or move for each different signals you 're able to program and command your swarm .

figure.rend: Build a Model of a Swarm Robot Step 18.jpg

item.s: Solder an infrared transmitter the same way you connected and programmed an LCD .
Now each Swarm-Bot will be capable of communicating with any other robot near enough or within sight of the infrared .
